article.title: Hybrid phase-space--Fock-space approach to evolution of a driven nonlinear resonator

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the ellipse in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The area where the resonator is most likely to be found.
One standard deviation for the quadrature operators along any direction.
The trajectory of the resonator state in phase space.
The region of bistability for the resonator.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the scaling of the infidelity (1-F) with |β| at large |β|  in Figure 2 indicate?
choices: The conversion between Gaussian and Fock-space Gaussian states becomes less accurate with increasing photon number.
The conversion between Gaussian and Fock-space Gaussian states becomes more accurate with increasing photon number.
The fidelity of the conversion is independent of the photon number.
The fidelity of the conversion is only accurate for specific values of the parameters.
The effective temperature of the resonator.
The steady-state squeezing of the resonator.
The infidelity of the conversion between Gaussian and Fock-space Gaussian states.
The rate of energy relaxation in the resonator.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the solid blue line crossing the horizontal "3 dB" line in Figure 9(a)?
choices: The resonator state achieves 3 dB squeezing in the steady state.
The resonator state can exceed 3 dB squeezing during transients.
The resonator state is always below 3 dB squeezing.
The hybrid evolution equations break down at this point.
